text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: It is our attitude towards events, not events themselves, which we can control. Nothing is by its own nature calamitous - even death only if we fear it.
author: Epictetus

text: One thing only I know, and that is I know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: I and I alone am responsible for How I think and feel.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: A popular man arouses the jealousy of the powerful.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The learning of the wise, the justice of the great, the prayers of the righteous and the valor of the brave. All of these are as nothing without a ruler who knows the art of ruling. Make that the science of your tradition.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Mood? What has mood to do with it? You fight when the necessity aries - no matter the mood! Mood's a thing for cattle or making love or playing the baliset. It's not for fighting.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Any road followed precisely to its end leads precisely nowhere. Climb the mountain just a little bit to test that its a mountain. From the top of the mountain, you cannot see the mountain.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Here I am, Here I remain.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Be prepared to appreciate what you meet.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Most civilizations are based on cowardice. It's so easy to civilize by teaching cowardice. You water down the standards which would lead to bravery. You restrain the will. You regulate the appetites. You fence in the horizons. You make a law for every movement. You deny the existence of chaos. You teach event the children to breathe slowly. You take.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Most believe that a satisfactory future requires a return to an idealized past, a past which never in fact existed.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: History is a constant race between invention and catastrophe. Education helps but it's never enough.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The concept of progress acts as a protective mechanism to shield us from the terrors of the future.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: It's shocking to find how many people do not believe they can learn, and how many believe learning to be difficult.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The mind commands the body and it obeys. The mind orders itself and meets resistance.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Try looking into that place where you dare not look. You'll find me there staring at you.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The willow submits to the wind and prospers until one day it is many willows - a wall against the wind.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: It is a curious thing, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Having your cash lose 5% from inflation is better than losing it 100% from a bad investment.
author: Morgan Housel

text: Trust no one who doesn't have to be accountable for their action.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: The more complicated an investment, the better probability of it being a scam.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: If everyone's doing it, I won't be doing it, or better try to look at it from the shovel perspective.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: The better investment will always be something you can control vs something you cannot.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
author: Mark Twain

text: Courage is resistance to fear. Mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: A fancy website and slick copywriting doesn't mean it's legit.
author: Probably Me

text: Win the game to not play it again.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: What is admired in one generation is abhorred in another. We cannot say who will survive the holocaust of memory. We are men only, a brief flare of the torch.
author: Madeline Miller [The Song of Achilles]

text: Do not let what you gained this day be so easily lost.
author: Madeline Miller [The Song of Achilles]

text: A tinker's debt is always paid. One for any simple trade. Twice for freely-given aid. Thrice for any insult made.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: The key is to keep the proper amount in your purse. Two little and they would be disappointed and prime to look for more. Too much and they would be excited and might get greedy.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Only priests and fools are fearless, and I've never been on the best of terms with Gods.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: A clever thoughtless person is one of the most terrifying things there is.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Remember: There are three things all wise men fear, the sea in storm, a night  with no moon, and the anger of a gentleman.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: If you possess too much power, people don't dare point out your mistakes. Power can be a terrible thing.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Beautiful game: The point is to be bold. To be dangerous. Be Elegant. Any man that’s half awake can spot a trap that’s laid for him. But to stride in boldly with a plan to turn it on its ear, that is a marvelous thing. To set a trap and know someone will come in wary, ready with a trick of their own, then beat them. That is twice marvelous.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: You've deduced a universal truth: things are usually unfair.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: It's the question we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right time.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: So when I meet a woman, I should simply say, 'You are beautiful'? No. You should say simply 'beautiful' and let the woman decide the rest of what you mean.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: If you added up all the time wasted searching for shortcuts and trying to cheat the process, the hard work could have already been done by now.
author: James Clear [Habit Guy]

text: Many of us seek community solely to escape the fear of being alone. Knowing how to be solitary is central to the art of living. When we can be alone we can be with others without using them as a means escape.
author: Bell Hooks [All about love]

text: When your sample is large, no single instance will significantly change the aggregate or the total.
author: Some Math Guy

text: We build toys. Some of those toys change the world.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Missing a train is only painful if you run after it. Not matching the idea of success other expect from you is only painful if that's what you are seeking.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: You stand above the rat race and the pecking order, not outside of it, if you do so by choice.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: I'm beginning to think decisiveness is overrated but I reserve the right to change my mind.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does
author: Charles Darwin [The Descent of Man]

text: Great thinkers don’t harbor doubts because they’re impostors. They maintain doubts because they know we’re all partially blind and they’re committed to improving their sight. They don’t boast about how much they know; they marvel at how little they understand. They’re aware that each answer raises new questions, and the quest for knowledge is never finished. A mark of lifelong learners is recognizing that they can learn something from everyone they meet. Arrogance leaves us blind to our weaknesses. Humility is a reflective lens: it helps us see them clearly. Confident humility is a corrective lens: it enables us to overcome those weaknesses.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: The absence of conflicts is not harmony, it's apathy.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: Note to self: on my next trip to the top of mount stupid, remember to take selfie.
author: Self

text: A weak argument generally dilutes a strong one.
author: A skilled Negotiators

text: We won't have much luck changing other people's mind if we refuse to change ours.
author: A skilled Negotiators

text: Even the devil appreciates being listened to
author: The Devil

text: It takes humility to reconsider our past commitments, doubt to question our present decisions and curiosity to re imagine our future plans. What we discover along the way can free us from the shackles of our familiar surroundings and our former selves. Rethinking liberates us to do more than update our knowledge and opinions its a tool for leading a more fulfilling life.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: Man was not made to belong to a group. Nor is he strictly an individual. For the concept of an individual can only exist when there simultaneously exists the concept of a group.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Belief is a useless concept. There is only knowing and not knowing.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Do whatever you like. Live in accordance with your sensibilities. Live and work in accordance with your own inspirations. This is your day to day existences. This is your life. What does god have to do with it?
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Because people are clever. They play ingenious little games with God. They offer a nickel and ask for a fortune. God is simply an insurance policy for them. They have no desire to know him or become him. They seek only to fortify their meager little lives with a few pleasant distractions and a modest seek of wealth and comfort. The kingdom of God is for the rarest man in the world. Millions speak of it. Only one purse it.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: You are drowning in a lake, do you weigh possibility and impossibility? Or do you simply act.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Anything of great value has great price. If you are asking for no less than God himself, you must give no less than your entire self.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The ego is not that which says that you are great. It is that which says that you exist at all. Confusion is a wonderful thing.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The greatest freedom that we have is the freedom to walk away from ourselves.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The king is not the one who possess wealth, the king is the one who is whilst possessing it, remains unattached to it. Because he doesn't feel an intimate ownership of it, he is not owned by it.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The man who knows that he will be a success makes 'hard work' work for him. To him it is a tool in his arsenal. The man who doesn't know, works for hard work. He relives upon hard work as the engine and vehicle to get him there. And this lather instance rarely works.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The trouble with mindfulness is that it requires persistent effort. It is like attempting to empty the ocean with a teacup.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Thoughts feel like imposters. Ideas seem like noise. Preferences fail to move you. Pride is easily dropped.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The greatest thing that you can give to the world is peace in your own life.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Miserable is what a man becomes when he hankers for happiness.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Can rain come without the invitation of the cloud.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: A part of relishes getting angry. For when you do, you are able to exercise your right to become angry. You enjoy this right. For you feel that you have been wronged, and thus your anger is justified. You do not wish to pass up on exercising this right. But another part of you feel remorse for having been angry. And this remorse is to some degree, disingenuous. The remorse makes you feel better and morally correct. For if you had felt good about getting angry, you would have a difficult time accepting yourself.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Buddha did not try to change the world. He turned himself into a Buddha. And because he did, the world began to change.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, it to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't do.
author: Henry Ford

text: Goal that are challenging are motivators; goals that are impossible is just depressing.
author: Probably Me

text: If a competitor can out execute a startup once the idea is known, the startup is doomed anyway. The reason to build a new team to pursue an idea is that you believe you can accelerate through the Build-Measure-Learn feedback loop faster than anyone else can.
author: Eric Ries

text: Keep strong, if possible. In any case, keep cool. Have unlimited patience. Never corner an opponent, and always assist him to save face. Put yourself in his shoes - so as to see thing through his eyes. Avoid self-righteousness like the devil - nothing is so self-blinding.
author: Stillness is the Key

text: If you have the power to change the world, then that power can be used to destroy it as well.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: My dear friend, the entire point of life is to find ways to get others to do your work for you. Don't you know anything about basic economics?
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]
